abstract.text: A specification for constraining a node’s position or rotation.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object describes a mathematical constraint on a node’s position or orientation. You attach constraints to nodes; after a scene processes any actions and physics interactions, it applies constraints attached to nodes in its node tree. Use constraints to ensure that certain relationships are true before the system renders a scene. For example, you might use a constraint to:
property so that it always points at another node or a position in the scene.
Keep a node within a specified distance of another node or a point in the scene.
Keep a node inside a specified rectangle.
property of a node so that it has a more limited rotation range of motion.
object that contains one or more constraint objects and assign the array to a node’s
property. When the system evaluates a scene, it executes the constraints on a node in the order they appear in the
You can’t change a constraint after you create it. However, you can selectively disable or enable a constraint by setting its
property. You can also use the
property to convert positions to the referenced coordinate system before applying the constraint.

abstract.text: An object representing a static ordered collection, for use instead of an  constant in cases that require reference semantics.
Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.
A specification for constraining a node’s position or rotation.
Creates a constraint that keeps a node within a certain distance of another node.
Creates a constraint that keeps a node within a certain distance of a point.
Creates a constraint that keeps a node within a certain distance of a point in another node’s coordinate system.
A Boolean value that specifies whether the constraint is applied.
Creates a constraint that forces a node to rotate to face a point in another node’s coordinate system.
Creates a constraint that forces a node to rotate to face another node.
Creates a constraint that forces a node to rotate to face a fixed point.
Creates a constraint that restricts the x-coordinate of a node’s position.
Creates a constraint that restricts both coordinates of a node’s position.
Creates a constraint that restricts the y-coordinate of a node’s position.
The node whose coordinate system should be used to apply the constraint.
Creates a constraint that limits the orientation of a node.
A list of constraints to apply to the node.
The Euler rotation about the z axis (in radians).
A specification of the degree of freedom when solving inverse kinematics.
Make a node automatically rotate itself based on the changing position of another node, by using orientation constraints.
Create a position constraint and add it to a node.
Gain fine-tuned control of objects that are connected by joints.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
Limit a node’s movement in one axis or both.
Provide limitations on a node’s rotation, or create rules the system uses to update a node’s rotation for you.
Create a rule the system uses to update a node’s position relative to another node in the scene.

Provide limitations on a node’s rotation, or create rules the system uses to update a node’s rotation for you.
Create a rule the system uses to update a node’s position relative to another node in the scene.

value.title: Controlling the Coordinate System Where a Constraint is Applied

value.text: A static ordered collection of objects.
